duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide first aid and medical triage for employees, and refer to outside medical providers when necessary.
Create and implement a first aid care plan for injured employees, including self-care instructions.
Facilitate the workers’ compensation and return-to-work process for employees with work-related injuries.
Maintain medical supply inventory and ensure a clean and orderly environment.
Participate in incident investigations and weekly case management review meetings.
Attend associate committee meetings, greeting new hires, and coaching on at-risk work habits.
Provide daily activity logs and end-of-shift reports.
Train and teach first aid, CPR, and AED certification classes to employees.
Participate in special projects and ad hoc tasks as assigned.
Work flexible shifts, including days, nights, and weekends.
Communicate effectively, display professional behavior, and maintain composure in emergencies.
Follow direction, policy, and procedures in an inclusive and diverse atmosphere.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent, valid first aid, CPR, and AED certification, and emergency medical technician or paramedic certification, or relevant degree in health-related fields.
